info.name: Way of the Mountain's Eye
info.description: The Way of the Mountain's Eye from Paddy's Homebrew
info.author: Paddy's Homebrew

description.p: The mountain is a sturdy landmark of the world. Intimidating and unyielding, the mountain endures all aspects of nature. The way of the mountains eye is a discipline that embodies the spirit of the mountain and harnesses the power of observation.

Mountain Monks train themselves to identify the weaknesses of their enemies through observation of their physiological history. A broken bone that never fully healed, a scar inflicted by a terrifying opponent, a wound received during a devastating battle, these are the things that a mountain Monk sees in their opponents and knows how to target.

p.em: 3rd-level Way of the Mountain's Eye feature

description.p: Your keen understanding of the structure of buildings and creatures allows you to identify the cracks and wounds, even of those that have long since faded.
Beginning at 3rd level you can use your bonus action to examine a creature or structures weaknesses.
Once per turn, when striking a creature or structure you have examined, it recieves the following effects when succesfully attacked
If your target is a living creature, upon a successful attack you can spend 1 Ki point to remove its resistance to all types of damage until the start of your next turn.
If your target is a structure, you deal the maximum damage to it.

sheet.description: Beginning at 3rd level you can use your bonus action to examine a creature or structure. If the target is a structure you deal the maximum amount of damage to it. If the target is a living creature, upon a successful attack you can remove its resistance to damage until the start of your next turn.

p.em: 3rd-level Way of the Mountain's Eye feature

description.p: Your very strike crumbles the enemies resolve, both for their mind and their body.
Beginning at 3rd level on a successful attack, you can spend a ki point to give the target disadvantage on either wisdom or constitution saving throws until the start of your next turn.

sheet.description: Beginning at 3rd level on a successful attack, you can spend a ki point to give the target disadvantage on a saving throw of your choice until the start of your next turn.

p.em: 6th-level Way of the Mountain's Eye feature

description.p: Your fists no longer just deal damage to your opponents body, each strike you make inflicts damage on your enemies mind. Your unarmed strikes deal psychic damage.
Additionally, any critical hit made with unarmed strikes causes your opponent to become afraid of you until the start of your next turn.

p.em: 11th-level Way of the Mountain's Eye feature

description.p: Channelling your mountainous integrity makes you an unchallengable force of movement

Starting at 11th level you can spend 1 ki point and use your action to momentarily becomes an unstoppable force. You can move up to half of your movement speed dealing damage to anything you make contact with.

Any creature or structure you come within 5ft of during this movement takes a number of d8 equivalent to your dex modifier. Any creature you come into contact with must make a strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

sheet.description: you can use your action to momentarily become an unstoppable force. By spending a ki point you can travel half your normal speed dealing damage to anything you make content with. This attack deals {{wisdom:modifier}}d8 bludgeoning damage once to each creature or structure that you come within 5ft of until the end of this movement.

p.em: 17th-level Way of the Mountain's Eye feature

description.p: The body and mind are interconnected, and your comprehension of this link allows you to strike with the intent of damaging both mind and body simultaneously.
At level 17 when you hit a creature with unnamed strike, you can expend 3 ki points to paralyse them, after the paralysis ends they are frightened of you for the next 10 minutes.
